result.execSummary:
The defendant Maryann Serrano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Cash bail applied, remaining bail to be refunded to poster. All court costs paid in full.

 Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Court ordered 11 days Huber with Standard Release Conditions. Defendant to report to Huber Facility by 7:00 pm on 04-12-2019.
04/17/2019 SENTENCE CORRECTED TO 14 DAYS WITH 9 DAYS CREDIT.
NEW REPORT DATE IS04/26/2019
Case no. 15CM2063 is dismissed and read in.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maryann Serrano

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Jesinski advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

Per Judge Lau:  The intent of the Court at the 4/5/19 plea and sentencing hearing was that the defendant serve an additional 2 days in custody.  Defendant reported to Huber as ordered at the hearing but there was a conflict between the intent of the court and the language in the Judgment of Conviction.  Court will allow defendant to select a new report date.  Court orders Judgment of Conviction be corrected to reflect the intent of the Court as follows.  All fines and surcharges remain as previously ordered.

The Court Orders the Following:
14 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 9 days).  Defendant to report to Huber facility by 7:00 pm on April 26, 2019
Letter regarding Huber non-compliance filed by Waukesha County Jail Corrections Captain.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:54 AM Defendant Maryann  Serrano in court with attorney Kyle E Jesinski.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentencing.  Defense is not ready to proceed with a change of plea and requests an adjournment.  Court will set this matter for trial.  Parties select trial dates.  Case recalled at 11:23.  Defendant would like to enter a change of plea at this time.  Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Case 15CM2063 dismissed and read in to this matter.

The Court Orders the Following:
11 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 9 days).  Defendant to report to Huber facility by 7:00 pm on April 12, 2019

COSTS: $ 253.00
	
DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: Cash bail to be applied.  Any remaining cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 5, 2019 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 13, 2019 at 03:30 pm.

10:42 AM Defendant Maryann  Serrano in court with attorney Kyle E Jesinski.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jesinski requests an adjournment for reasons stated on the record.  The court grants the request and reschedules the case for plea and sentencing. If the case does not resolve at the next hearing the court will schedule the case for trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 13, 2019 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 23, 2019 at 10:00 am.

03:31 PM Defendant Maryann  Serrano in court with attorney Kyle Jesinski.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jesinksi has received an offer and requests the court schedule the case for plea and sentencing.  The court schedules accordingly.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 23, 2019 at 10:00 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

records.addlTxt: $250.00 cash bail was previously ordered on this case when the defendant was in custody at Milwaukee House of Corrections, but was apparently was never posted.  The Courts intention was to not have the defendant post any additional cash bail.  Per Commissioner Scullen, Court will order a $500.00 signature bond on 15CM2063 and will reinstate the $500.00 cash bail that was previously posted on 15CM485.
Pre-trial conference on December 4, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
